CB701DFC54024255A6B73DAD3DC0FC95.description: reflects on, analyzes, and assesses strategies used while learning Dene.

1CD7A80A1DDF488D837C26E92E621049.description: determines personal inquiry and learning goals; and,

4C1B93B2D81741E595F7DDF9AD939B11.description: reflects on new knowledge of Dene and its value to self and the wider community;

68F3F5C22CB14F6AA6CB903D8AB536C5.description: determines personal inquiry and research strengths and language goals;

DD61D285ED8B4081B66BFD5D2982B340.description: reviews, refines, through reflection, feedback and self-assessment;

7F6E1EC8DAAD4AB0B8F00E2D0CA1A2DD.description: reflects on attainment of personal goals for effective language learning and use;

2845FABFCD1C47E4B20B0A7C94971569.description: assesses own and others' work for clarity, correctedness, and impact;

C0E5612668A84B7A8D3CB2948843F570.description: assess personal strengths and needs within the development of their own language learning as they relate to family, community and land and set goals for future improvement.

8DB7A9A0A75A4495A61C278281B1A6B9.description: uses criteria and rubrics to evaluate presentations including the purpose, delivery, content, visual aids, body language, and facial expressions.

9A6BDB4494014A3B89602C1E10F945E2.description: evaluates and modifies own roles in group interactions; and,

73E785FD474147339914F6B176E9D462.description: recognizes speaking, listening, viewing and representing are useful tools for clarifying thinking, communicating and learning;

716B37B00AC443E69EB93603A3C82912.description: reflects on factors that influence identity through the use of the Dene language;

A7297537935B45BD9CF7A462350E85FF.description: assess personal strengths and needs within the development of their own language skill, and set goals for future improvement.

6BC32173B3294A1DA16524CB140F299E.description: discusses options using words for possibility, comparison, contrast and cause; e.g., compare and contrast artwork done by Saskatchewan artists, or discuss the pros and cons of living in the city.

E78022E2AC02462B9EB0317CD5377742.description: gives a set of instructions with appropriate sequence, rules, conditions and imperatives, such as how to make jam using blueberries or raspberries, or how to clean and tan a moose hide; and,

1A25CE09B966451D9A8C63D44D4A6935.description: describes or narrates an experience, event or situation with supporting detail; e.g., life on the trapline, prepare wild game, setting a fishnet, or educational experiences;

CC65EC12B3104FDF8E18F44C24668721.description: explores effective forms for recording and presenting and uses for research findings, such as CD-ROM's, video archives, children's literature;

9FF7ACC6CAF5442AA0228D9544480021.description: perform language functions that allow them to produce communication.

59E4DEF42C834D37BA52F4ACF9B57D26.description: approaches cultural resource people with appropriate protocol for collecting information;

04984B8F34FC4036BE081CDEE987023C.description: identifies possible sources of information, resource people, written resources and media resources;

117CF879AD334AE6A1FB11F2E2FA1600.description: forms possible research or inquiry questions;

359E37999F0C402ABCB0FBCF7577A13D.description: identifies and inquires a need or purpose for collecting cultural information in consultation with Elders;

436A890023F2476A9A43D14DDE218BD9.description: perform language functions that allow them to produce research.

C764552F77D346E292000F84F2F29593.description: relates personally to a character or situation in moral stories.

E7173F6B564C4BE3888CAC2D7D610C09.description: demonstrates recognition of language techniques used for effectiveness of presentation such as voice, or the use of metaphors; and,

EA38C69A7DC9495AA2BC13272C967032.description: searches for meaning in the unspoken discourse, such as ellipses, symbols, metaphors;

0A7C268ACB5C479788C6FD73BF743208.description: after hearing/viewing/reading discourse: demonstrates by outlining, summarizing, paraphrasing and answering questions, comprehension of main idea and details;

172E153D75F440819D1ED14112C68A0B.description: engages in previewing or hearing activities that orient to the discourse, such as providing background knowledge, recalling what is already known;

C68B24C135724E4BBB557BC5A13D3ACD.description: perform language functions that allow them to interpret communications.

18B0973DE7604093ADABA50A649ADDE9.description: demonstrates and uses language families and dialects-systematic sound differences and reasons for differences in vocabulary.

34DC992C6CE24EFE8CDA0BEF17F650F4.description: uses language and other protocols governing relationships between and among people during ceremonies and special events; and,

2C123BF09E004D229BF1408BD7B5570B.description: uses inclusive language to welcome guests into the home, school or community (tawow! astam, pehtoke);

0A175FDE668B4E0A9460B18AA1FF733D.description: perform language functions that allow them to socialize and celebrate.

9CCDC0F30C3742D0BC0D75ECF31B42C2.description: asks questions, asks for repetition to clarify understanding.

D0B1F9C306CF4C359C731FFE9CC43143.description: seeks information to help formulate personal understanding; and,

71B4D3DB81294BBFB98FCEFA05E720A2.description: develops ways of organizing and clarifying personal thinking and ideas;

A54436584ADA4BDC88978EFBFB93AC68.description: uses questions to understand new idea;

B1AFA971BADF44939D13F45D048EE4BB.description: uses Dene to persuade or convince (e.g., eka takohteci wipac, kika-ati-sipwehtanaw. You'll arrive soon and then we will get ready to leave. Eka kimiwahki wapahki, kika-nitawipakasimonaw, kakwe-kaskimew or kakwesakocimew) Providing it doesn't rain, we will go and swim;

9CAE49C5CD694A20950D1E3FE7895617.description: follows simple instructions for doing something (e.g., brush teeth, wash face, write on the board);

A1B4410FA4174F6F83078F81346C7FF8.description: discusses plans (e.g., going to the library, going for coffee, meeting for volleyball);

ED6CBB74BEB247E1BCB064D8F319DEA7.description: perform language functions that allow the learner to receive and give information.

B28054A7921B45C1895B807C1F5D4A7A.description: uses a variety of patterns in their own texts.

8B498EAA30F64974A02A2D7299528E09.description: uses a variety of conventions to structure texts (e.g., titles, poetry, and riddles/jokes); and,

FB760C87EF1745B5B675B5D43925B851.description: uses a variety of short oral texts on unfamiliar topics in guided situations;

936981D6E3964097ADE0BD12D6C1FCF4.description: uses simple linking devices, such as "maka-but," "ekosi-so," "kispin-if" and "ohci-therefore," appropriately in spontaneous speech to create a sense of flow and coherency;

83FDEBC5BFCA4B989FC50D69D047E55B.description: expresses some logical relations in discourse;

3B4AA47941B047D0AB5069FDD992CBC7.description: conveys an idea in discourse with a logical sequence of events and with simple but effective detail;

2B2030E52D1E494B8167D5D4F766F2A4.description: communicate meaningfully with coherency (coherency relates to the connectedness of information, thoughts and ideas within discourse).

6C02784506084241B4D8DCEB81F62DD8.description: produces basic phrases, short sentences, and questions using learned vocabulary and simple language structures.

E9C2201A6B4F4FB6AB516EC8AFFFC75F.description: participates in a simple conversation with a Dene speaker using repetition and explanation;

91140FF9E1104B6D9684AD68C5F37E97.description: manages simple, routine interactions with ease and asks for clarification when necessary;

BD03F9B73A4549BE8FD1FD48797321DD.description: produces speech at a normal or slower than normal rate that requires some repetition to be understood by a first language speaker;

41951277205E49D8BF14CB1B942EA5C6.description: communicate meaningfully with proficiency (proficiency is the ability of an individual to speak or perform in an acquired language).

DE1E7E4166E94D478DBAA25FBF9ED2EE.description: produces a variety of short, simple oral texts in guided and unguided situations.

0814632C5AF640958810FF1B1E07873F.description: uses a wider range of common verbal affixes with relative accuracy; and,

484632CEFE614876AAEFFC790F433BAA.description: produces sentences containing a subordinate clause;

9232B099798A4288AD28B4175C373D28.description: uses specific vocabulary associated with a range of common topics;

9E6CDEFF092A44E1A3EC937E752242EC.description: produces sounds of language that are difficult for the student learning an additional language, with enough clarity to prevent misunderstandings of common words;

B018C63A80804B13A18F69E0FB15F192.description: communicate meaningfully with accuracy (accuracy primarily the syntactical and semantical conventions of a language).

E98481717E7A4B5EAF0794FDC33C211C.description: identifies and develops own strengths related to Dene language and culture.

7BBEE1F853714C95BB809F51B285FA60.description: identifies language and cultural role models (who they are and what makes them unique); and,

CFF083243C6E4FF7BE8680AD2D8D75A8.description: works with language mentors (e.g., parents, friends, peers, Eldersk) to monitor and improve own learning;

F54F072921114D5DB9B98D34E8B0B1D0.description: identifies effective mental techniques to improve learning Dene;

A56DB47DF5C34A368AD226908BB4CBE5.description: demonstrates willingness to take risks and to try unfamiliar tasks and approaches;

C844B558D066450CB108A0F6E879E2FA.description: asks for clarification or repetition to aid understanding;

C5271B0E472D4C698DC3979C0CCB573F.description: repeats and uses new words and expressions occurring in conversation with others;

12666A8EB000485FB4CB3D60163CA6CA.description: develops criteria for assessing own work;

D3DEB04413E24E1CA68A0DD83723A7BD.description: identifies problems that may hinder successful completion of a task and seek solutions;

CD9AC1A027B4473A90C92B43BCC65241.description: demonstrates how strategies may assist with texts containing unknown elements;

CA5FA76C759049DE8B43B85227AEB7D5.description: demonstrates awareness of learning through direct exposure to Dene by asking questions when someone is speaking;

A632635EE9984F22AC1583C1AFDAA9BC.description: uses key content words or context clues to follow an extended text;

65880D485DA04A5BB4EFCB6902334CD2.description: places new words or expressions in a context to make them easier to remember;

8FA4BB6310544AF781260CBD2D8321E6.description: uses graphic representations (e.g., word maps, mind maps, diagrams, charts) to make information easier to understand and to remember;

64C61E0D18A14B7F971256E0D5893FBD.description: identifies and justifies the evidence on which inferences are based;

9FFE6C6C410E442CBEE26EE989A5350B.description: makes personal notes when hearing useful language;

E7665429A39C451186504281A35436A6.description: volunteers initiating or ending a conversation;

8DFC129FDE8E40689BD45FC2E5C1DC7B.description: seeks opportunities to use or hear the language;

2A9510136E0B495D851EF82F22CCE954.description: uses reference materials and speakers to help in clarifying a message;

4A43DDC4FCB54E1992C5F461C4F7A92A.description: uses grammatical knowledge to correct errors or to improve their language;

6A5E3EF6DC7745D1BCE130A4218E9573.description: distinguishes relevant information from irrelevant information when trying to get the gist of a speech or difficult conversation;

8FBC04FFCD5E419689493FB778201F5A.description: decides in advance what to listen for;

EBC05F043E624B1B92061AD96825D53A.description: Develop and use various strategies to enhance the meaning of learning and communication.

6C3BF15D4D1A49F7ADB664DCBED8882B.description: presents an oral narrative or other creative text and accompanies it with a visual, kinesthetic or oral presentation that adds to its effectiveness for a particular audience, such as a poem put to music, script or dialogue acted out, or gives instructions on how to do a particular task.

67A8788D0021436C962C555676E3273A.description: writes a factual report based on inquiry and presents information accompanies the written report with a visual, oral or kinaesthetic presentation that adds to its effectiveness for a particular audience;

1FB707F3647A46008899E224A1717AFE.description: writes notes and presents orally to capture basic information from inquiry or from a personal or electronic source, such as a short interview, weather report or short film;

7277CF76B23146A79CA65CE84F69DE7A.description: shares personal reflections created, such as a speech and as written text, in response to personal experiences or Dene world-views;

E6ABC3BD599A477BAA445FA0391435DF.description: retells parts of oral narratives orally and in written form, and combines with various mediums of expression, such as dance, puppetry, art, or drama;

52E9E2FAB22B46929752238727D129BA.description: communicates thoughts, ideas, feelings for specific purposes and audiences through a variety of verbal and visual media in guided situations;

4497484E617A4E84AD7E8935F2B23E5E.description: produces text on familiar topics, providing detail to support main point, in guided situations;

87F31AAE84084275A2D0F95951E9F899.description: produce language that is understandable to others.

A609AE252FAC43E98124BAC1AA8866E8.description: reads and interprets a descriptive passage of text or a detailed set of instructions for a process, supported with occasional informative illustrations.

0EADE57C78FE4A908CBC68FC6F141DD1.description: reads and interprets simple excerpts from stories from the oral tradition; stories should be supported with occasional informative illustrations, photos, or other visual representations; and,

DE7905D0EB274F84BBC5A9CE83A36859.description: listens to and interprets some of the proceedings of community meetings regarding topics relevant to cultural areas of study, such as meetings with Elders, band council meetings, school committee meetings;

94BF3ED889F0476B9D94D7FCEE0A2146.description: interprets and responds to contemporary Dene reflections expressed in a variety of mediums, such as documentaries on a topic of choice, or modern Dene art, dance, drama, and music;

07B0D0A57145483CA56CB3D8E845F82F.description: interprets and responds to traditional narratives of the people relating to areas of Dene world-views: histories, moral stories, songs, informational texts and entertaining stories, from electronic or print mediums;

A7543F6129CE44D089613005E62E9A3F.description: understand and interpret the Dene language as a connected set of ideas expressed in sentences.

5B876DB2A7AF456AB6FF11DFB3902943.description: interacts with Elders or cultural resource people while inquiring about the Dene world-view to learn about the history, past practices and past customs.

7265EAB9DA4F47438174A73C8E15B093.description: interacts with members of the community in acts of service to the community, such as helping with the preparation of activities, programming for community radio, television or print media; and,

ECA0765F732344749A5235C5A0A3DF13.description: interacts with members of the community while participating in community events, such as winter festival, language festival, dance competitions or music festivals;

0EAEC08483B3483981BF58271BD4DFFE.description: interacts with members of the community and Elders while participating in culture camps;

FC8907C3C9104558A0B03990A2CAFA40.description: interacts with Elders or cultural resource people to learn cultural skills in the learners' natural surroundings;

05C3956701CD435B95587BA38487AA0D.description: listens and responds to a variety of extended text forms in a variety of media (e.g., short stories, films, plays, etc.);

83013EAE55484176B767102AB72DE354.description: identifies the main point and supporting details of lengthy texts on topics of interest in guided situations.;

DB945E60A7FC448A8861A1F6B1B9F39C.description: identifies the purpose of texts (e.g., to describe, retell, persuade, entertain and instruct);

796BA44FBFD0413D8328C0F69CE6CA03.description: listens and responds to short texts on topics of interest in guided or unguided situations;

7A069449F64D481B96048A5E1A2C19EB.description: view, interact with, and experience the natural and constructed environments of the community.
